titles.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that there should be no increase in Federal taxes in order to fund additional Government spending.

referral.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Mr. Hayworth moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 208.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 371 - 48, 3 Present (Roll no. 538).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

referral.text: Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Finance.
